frame.name: Firing_point
frame.definition:
<def-root>A location from which a <fen>Detonator</fen> activates a distantly-located explosive device.
<ex>Locating the <t><fex name="fir">firing point</fex></t> of remote control IEDs is no easy task.</ex>
<ex>The first task is to determine where he located <fex name="det">his</fex> <t><fex name="fir">firing point</fex></t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Firing_point
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location from which the <fen>Detonator</fen> activates an explosive device.
<ex>Can you identify a <t><fex name="fir">firing point</fex></t>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>A place that a <fen>Firing_point</fen> is located with respect to.
<ex>Any <t>firing points</t> <fex name="rel">outside this zone</fex> should not be approached.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Descriptor is a temporary condition of the <fen>Firing_point</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="des">abandoned</fex> <t>firing point</t> yielded minimal forensic evidence.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Detonator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Detonator</fen> is located at the <fen>Firing_point</fen> when he or she activates the explosive device.
<ex>We could not identify <fex name="det">their</fex> firing point.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: firing point.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: location from which a remote detonated bomb is activated.
